inn1.comm: wild start down the leg side, not what England wanted and South Africa are off and running
leg side again from Anderson, clipped down to fine leg as Amla opens his account
outside off, Smith leans forward and pushes into the covers for a well-judged single
excellent batting already, dropped into the leg side and the good understanding between Amla and Smith allows another single
on the stumps, searching for some inswing, Smith works it through midwicket but deep square-leg keeps it to a single
the ball is going dead straight so far, Amla stands tall and defends to the off side
some aggression to end the over, banged in outside off stump and Amla drops his hands to allow it through to the keeper
he also starts with a leg-side wide and then has a kick at the footholes
he gets away with this one which is again on leg stump and Smith flicks it straight to short fine-leg

well, what an early breakthrough for England as Broad pitches the ball up and finds a hint of movement to trap Smith on the crease as he plays to leg...wasn't a huge appeal to be honest, and it didn't look stone dead, but England won't be bothered about that
well bowled again, full outside off which draws de Villiers into a loose drive and misses the outside edge
outside off, good line, left alone through to Prior
shoulders arms again, carries fairly low through to the keeper
pitched up on off stump, de Villiers comes half forward and defends to cover
back of a length, Amla jumps into line and defends to the off side
banging the ball in, keeps Amla on the back foot as he defends down by his feet
it's clearly a plan to pin Amla on the back foot, this one is turned around the corner on the leg side for a sharp single
bangs in a bouncer outside off, de Villiers not interested as he watches it sail through
that's more like it, fuller and closer to off stump but de Villiers can still leave alone
in the channel outside off, still no shot from de Villiers as he gets used to conditions
back of a length to Amla, forced back down the pitch where Broad fields in his follow through
the middle of the pitch gets plenty of work when Amla is on strike, he defends comfortably to the on side
turned off his hip and sweetly timed but picks out the man at square leg
short outside off, this one flies through and beats Amla's attempted upper-cut
forced off the back foot into the covers...England building good pressure even if the length is a little off
that's Amla at his best, punches off the back foot between cover and mid-off with just enough timing to beat Pietersen's dive into the boundary
better length outside off, left alone
full and searching for swing, met with a perfect straight drive from de Villiers which races down the ground. But that shouldn't worry Anderson
pulls the length back a fraction, dropped square on the off side and it could be a tight single but the throw from backward point misses the stumps...Amla was probably safe
short again at Amla, he brings out the pull but the ball is well intercepted by Luke Wright at square leg
hint of width offered up, Amla cuts but can't beat backward point
short, wide and hammered with a upper cut over point...goes one bounce across the boundary
good line outside off, well judged and left alone
shoulders arms to another one...England are pitching it up except when Amla is on strike
gets behind this one and defends back down the pitch
tempting length outside off stump, de Villiers happy to leave alone again
lovely shot, waited for the ball and slotted it between cover and backward point with an open face...that was all timing, barely a follow through
on off stump and defended to cover
that's better, full at off stump and a hint of shape back into Amla who gets a thick inside edge as he drives without much footwork
beaten outside off as he plays a flat-footed waft to ball that didn't seem to bounce as Amla expected
tight on off stump, Amla drives firmly down to mid-off
half an appeal here as Amla moves right across his stumps and plays the pull...the ball scoots past his gloves but didn't touch anything and isn't called a wide, either
driven into the covers

gone! England have their second and a fuller length pays off as Amla flicks straight to short midwicket...that's a good fielding position for Amla who didn't get over the ball and Anderson was clearly delighted with that
on off stump, defended with bat and pad together into the off side
comes across outside off stump and defends back down the pitch
full outside off stump, de Villiers frees his arms and flays the ball in the air between cover and mid-off...that was risky, but he gets away with it
full on the stumps, that's the spot, and de Villiers defends awkwardly to the leg side
left alone outside off
punched off the back foot to cover
on off stump, defended back down the pitch
full on off stump, driven into the covers
wayward bouncer down the leg side which Duminy ducks out of the way of
another short one which is helped around the corner to fine leg
probing away outside off, he should book in there for the spell
another leave from de Villiers who knows how important he now is to this innings
three leaves in a row to end the over
going across the left hander, left alone to the keeper
good line on off stump, Duminy jumps across and defends
dragged down a little short and Duminy latches onto it quickly with a strong pull that races through square leg
another short one and he nearly top edges it straight to fine leg but it goes on the bounce to Bresnan
full on middle and off, driven out to midwicket
ooh, that was a good leave, it shapes back from outside off and nearly shaves the timber as de Villiers lets it go...heart in mouth moment
good length ball nips back and Duminy misses a flick to leg
full and outside off stump, Duminy drives but straight to point

well, that was strange! A slower-ball bouncer catches the back of Duminy's bat as he tried to guide a pull away, and the ball looped slowly to Prior. England haven't bowled all that well and the pitch is flat, but it's 35 for 3.
Full and straight and defended out to the off side
good full length and left alone just outside off
good fielding off his own bowling saves Anderson as a full length ball is driven back down the ground
an ambitious appeal from Broad as de Villiers walks down the track and across his stumps and misses an attempted work to leg
this time he does connect and eases it through the leg side
good tight line around off and middle and it's prodded into the leg side
repeat delivery but de Villiers this time drops it by his feet and the batsmen cross
outside off again and Petersen watches it pass him
good full ball is pushed down to mid-on where a fumble allows the batsmen to come back for two
immediately finds the outside edge as a good length ball goes down to third man
slightly shorter, outside off and blocked firmly to point
worked into the leg side firmly but straight to mid-on
shorter this time, which makes no sense at his pace, and Petersen hangs back and crashes it over midwicket for a boundary
overcompensates with a half volley that is driven sweetly back down the ground
finishes with a better ball which is defended to cover but the damage has been done
starts with a shortish ball that is worked around the corner
gets a leading edge out one bounce to point
half edge half guided through the vacant slip area for a boundary
tighter line, around middle worked into the leg side
England continue to strike. Much fuller and de Villiers was disappointed but the replays show the ball was clipping the top of leg. Big wicket and South Africa are in real trouble
sharpish delivery on off stump is guided to backward point
bit short, bit too straight and turned easily around the corner
much better length and gets the outside half of the bat as the ball trickle down to third man
Petersen looks calm and in control, which given the situation and his inexperience, is impressive, as he watches one pass off stump
defended firmly into the off side
Wright over pitches and its clipped confidently out to deep mid-wicket
reverts to back of length and Boucher stands tall and blocks into the off side
prodded into the leg side for one
Boucher waits on it and back cuts to third man
nicely done, turned it into the leg side with soft hands
good length ball around off stump
defended into the off side
shorter delivery pulled with control to deep square-leg
Wright continues as the sun finally comes out. Defended into the off side
Wright slips and tumbles in his follow through, but not a lot else happened as the ball was defended
short and wide and Boucher controlled his cut shot well, beating the in-field for a boundary
action replay, short, wide and cut for four
back of a length again, but straighter and Boucher drops it towards cover
defended to cover
good tight line from Bresnan, honing in around off stump
defended back to the bowler, Bresnan looks in good rhythm here
this time drifts too close to leg stump and is steered to deep mid-wicket
better line defended out to cover
neatly taken from middle into the leg side
good tight line defended towards point
well that is sloppy from Swann. A full ball is clipped straight through Swann at midwicket and the ball goes all the way. Broad fuming
nice length this from Broad, fullish and around off stump, defended into off
clipped again to Swann, this time less firmly, and he makes no mistake
tight line outside off and blocked
similar line, Petersen tries to guide it to third man but gets too much of it and it goes to point
defended into the leg side, Boucher wanted a single, but there wasn't one there
hanging back and defended into off
big appeal from Bresnan as the ball nipped back and beat Boucher, but it was too high and probably missing leg
sharpish delivery that Boucher can only defend off the back foot to the bowler
fuller length this time and defended
good full length again and the batsmen can only defend
completes an excellent maiden over with another full ball defended into off
excellent fielding at cover from Pietersen as he dives to stop a strong drive from Petersen
drifting into middle and leg, flicked straight to short midwicket
turned off the stumps to that man at short midwicket again...needs to be careful not to get a leading edge
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
there's a run, flicked down to fine leg to end the sequence of scoreless deliveries
what a ripper! That's a beauty from Anderson, holding its line and beating Boucher's outside edge to take out the off stump...almost silence around the ground as South Africa slip further
touch more bounce on off stump, defended into the covers
continues with a tight line on off stump, defended into the midwicket area
gets onto the front foot and drives into the covers
back of a length outside, forced into the covers
whipped from off stump to short midwicket
touch fuller and again worked out to midwicket...another maiden for Bresnan
on off stump to the left hander, defended to the on side and Anderson fields in his follow through
pushed across outside off and left alone
angled across and again left alone
fuller and draws the drive which goes to cover

gone! Another for Anderson, that's four...South Africa in a real hole as McLaren, starved of any scoring opportunities, drives at a hint of width but can only pick out Collingwood at backward point and he wasn't going to miss that chance
outside off and left alone to end another successful over
on off stump, driven into the covers
driven from middle and off to midwicket
not offering any width, stays tight on off stump and defend back down the pitch
run off Bresnan shocker...worked wide of short midwicket
bangs in a short ball, speed gun says 90mph, Botha ducks underneath
angling in on off stump, defended back to Bresnan
dragged down short and Petersen pulls it comfortably out to deep square-leg
little too straight as he allows Botha to tuck this down to fine leg...Anderson annoyed with himself
waits for the ball and cuts down to third man
nice shape but Botha judges it well as he leaves along
this one doesn't bounce as much as expected, Botha plays over the top with his cut and Prior has a difficult take
outside off, left again and this time the carry is waist-height to the keeper
on off stump, worked to midwicket
the immaculate line continues and Petersen pushes back to the bowler
tries to drop this into a gap at cover but the fielders are in quickly
pushed into the leg side
a hint of width and Petersen's eyes light up but he can't make contact with his cut
uses his wrists and turns this one out to deep square-leg
extra bounce takes the outside edge and it flies high through the vacant slip area...may not have gone to hand even if someone had been there
that's five! A career-best for Anderson as it rears off a length and takes the outside edge through to Prior...that was almost unplayable and Anderson rightly takes all the plaudits
welcomes his fellow quickie with a bouncer but it was too short
fuller on off stump, Parnell confidently onto the front foot and defends to cover
nips between bat and pad, bobbles out to backward point
searching for the lbw, full on middle and off, Parnell defends solidly
finishes with one full and straight, dug out back to Anderson who has a shy at the stumps
bouncer which Petersen pulls away down to fine leg
back of a length, stands tall and defends to backward point
good job he hit that one, homing in on middle and off, pushed back down the pitch
full on off stump, pushed firmly into the covers
drops his hands and lets a short ball pass over off stump
defended off middle and Bresnan collects
chopped away to backward point
on off stump, can only defend with a straight bat
advances towards the bowler who drops short and the ball is clubbed through the leg side, but only a single to deep midwicket
shortish ball, worked down to mid on
nearly gets a leading edge but goes safely to mid off
punched off the back foot to cover
worked off the stumps towards deep square-leg, good running makes it into a couple
pushed firmly into the leg side, midwicket is on the edge of the circle
outside off, driven through the covers out to the sweeper
another single picked off into the leg side with the fielders on the edge of the ring

what a stunner! Andrew Strauss has pulled off a cracking catch at backward point (normally filled by the man bowling) as he flings himself low to his left to pluck the chance inches off the turf after Parnell tried to drive square. That gives Collingwood his 100th ODI wicket and England can do no wrong today.
outside off and left alone...successful over for Collingwood and another landmark for him
starts with a shortish ball that's casually pulled away to deep mid-wicket for a single
bit of aggression from fast bowler to fast bowler, short ball goes back to the bowler who shapes a throw at the stumps
shortish again and blocked into the off side
goes fuller this time but Morkel mistimes a flat-footed drive
Morkel looks a bit like Broad with the bat. Shapes a back-foot drive but mistimes it
fuller and left alone outside off
gently eased to long on for a single
nice looking drive is mistimed to mid-off
close, just cleared the infield. Attempted swipe catches the toe end, luck for Morkel there
slower ball and Petersen waits, pauses before very gently pulling it towards fine leg
but instead just pushes to long on for a single
Petersen keeps the strike with a neat steer to leg
worked to leg for a couple
far too short and easily swatted away to deep mid-wicket
leg side again and guided towards deep square-leg
tight line on off stump but carefully guided to third man
finally finds a good length and a bit of indecision in Petersen's forward defensive stroke
back of a length again and dropped into leg. Petersen keeps the strike
push and go from Petersen, dropped to mid-off and collects one
over pitched and a lovely free-armed drive down the ground
this time repeats the stroke but it wasn't quite full enough and lands short of short extra
slower ball, the off-spinner and it turned. Message there for Strauss.
another off spinner, 59mph and prodded into leg

another cutter but beat Morkel's defensive stroke. It jumped a little off the pitch and a long, long appeal was finally rewarded. Morkel was a long way down but replays suggested again that the umpire was right.
Petersen serenely defends into the off side
good delivery from Broad, bounced a bit from a good length defended back to the bowler
intent from Petersen, walks down at Broad and attempts an ugly heave and misses
another more attacking shot attempted but mistimed straight to point
walks down again and swiped but the ball trickles to mid-on
oh dear. Langeveldt gives himself a bit of room, swishes and misses. Bounced a bit but that won't give Petersen too much confidence
gets down on one knee and slogs it to cow corner. Excellent shot completes a composed fifty
turns this one into the leg side
slower ball have Langeveldt too much time to think and he misses an attempted guide to third man
pushed away into the leg side
this time Langeveldt  gets behind it and defends comfortably
prodded back to the bowler
turned from around off stump into the leg side. Doesn't take the single on offer
fired down the leg side for a bonus run
better line is defended back to the bowler
bit of extra bounce there catches the inside edge of Petersen's defensive stroke
slightly slower ball defended

Stunner! Petersen advances but Broad sees him coming and goes short. The attempted swipe is mistimed and Luke Wright, back-peddling, timed a one-handed leap perfectly to take a pearler in his right hand. Sums up England's performance perfectly.

inn2.comm: back of a length, Trott moves across and defends to the off side
same again from bowler and batsman as Trott plays into the off side
huge appeal from Parnell and the fielders for leg before, was a fuller ball which beat Trott's drive but it struck outside the line
the chase is away with a wide as Parnell pushes this too far across
loses his line down the leg side this time, Parnell straining for some extra pace...Trott did expose all his stumps
first runs off the bat, neatly flicked down to long leg
goes full on middle and leg, worked through midwicket and Strauss is away with a brace
played very late by Strauss as he waits for the ball then cuts it down in front of the wide second slip
nicely timed into midwicket with a flick, well cut off by midwicket
offers up some width as he drags the ball down but Trott misses out as he toe-ends a cut
middles this one with a strong drive, but Petersen makes a good save at cover
ooh, nearly drags this on as he gets an inside edge playing defensively which scoots past the stumps
turned off his pads to square leg
pushed off the back foot with nice timing past mid-off and there's time to come back for a second
comes onto the front foot and drives back to the bowler
splices a pull which loops over midwicket, didn't get hold of that one but just enough bat involved to clear the field
good line on off stump, defend solidly into the off side
fuller this time but Strauss again defends off the back foot
pushed into the off side
dropped in short, Strauss is quickly onto it and pulls through midwicket for the first boundary of the innings...he picked the length very early
great shot, a hint of width and Trott stands tall to drive elegantly through the covers...that's a sign of his form
back-to-back boundaries, this one is whipped off the stumps backward of square with more superb timing...that was a straight ball but he is seeing it so well
timed nicely again but straight to mid-on
on off stump, comes forward and pushes into the leg side
chipped in the air but falls short of mid-on, second time Trott has nearly given a catch but it isn't South Africa's day
pushed square on the off side
round the wicket, outside off and left alone...88mph
tries to turn through the leg side but plays it into his pad
angling in from around the wicket, Strauss again opts to leave alone
happy to watch to go past the off stump...England in no really hurry
makes him play this time, closer to off stump and defended square on the off side
cramped for room as he tries to guide to third man, runs off the face towards the slips
pushed across the right hander and Trott lets it go
dropped a fraction short, Trott is so quickly onto another pull which races through midwicket
again favouring the leg side, whipped from way outside off stump into the gap at midwicket
full outside off, left alone even though it was fairly close to the stumps
hint of extra bounce, Strauss defends with soft hands to backward point
tries to whip this through midwicket but nearly spoons a catch to mid-on...all safe in the end, though
more stunning timing from Trott, uses Morkel's pace as he just turns this from straight with barely a flourish and it beats the chasing square leg into the rope
down the leg side, flicks the pad and flies through the finger tips of Boucher as he flings himself at full stretch
round the wicket again, tucked out to square leg
good carry as Strauss leaves one that climbs outside off stump
defended from off stump towards mid-on
takes the outside edge but falls well short of slip
starts with a good length delivery outside off which Trott guides to deep point
short with a hint of width, Strauss' favourite area and cut away for four
same line but a bit fuller and Strauss mistimes a cover drive straight to the fielder
tighter line and a good length, blocked back to the bowler
full again and mistimed into the cover region
Strauss watches it pass off stump without alarm
on the stumps and worked to mid-on
driven into the covers
huge appeal goes unrewarded! Strauss flashes outside off and it looked a regulation nick. Big noise, all the fielders went up but given not out. Lucky escape I think.
much less going on on this occasion. Blocked into the off side
sharp delivery hurries the defensive stroke
goes fuller and Strauss tries to work it into leg but finds short midwicket
quieter stuff, blocked gently into the off side
a positive leave, if such a thing could exist. Stepped forward decisively to watch it go past
fuller length that Trott flicks into deep square
again Trott walks across his stumps to defend an off stump ball into the leg side
defends into the point region this time. It's good bowling from Parnell
Parnell with an appeal this time. A tad ambitious perhaps, Trott wondered across his stumps and missed an attempted flick to leg
Morkel continues to trouble Strauss, good length ball reared up and caught the outside edge but flew into the gap between second and fourth slip. Good bowling
defended into space in the off side
quick delivery cut down to third man
much fuller and Strauss played from his crease back towards the bowler
worked down to third man but quite close to Strauss so a little risky
defended into off completes a good over for Morkel
turned into the leg but straight to midwicket
Strauss advances a little and drives but straight to the man at short extra
catches a bit of an inside edge and the ball goes to short midwicket
this time it's just a bit too short which allows Strauss to rock back and pull it through midwicket
ooh, close! Gets the outside edge with a fuller ball but lands short of a diving floating slip
good shot, Strauss takes a couple of steps and heaves it over mid-on for four
Trott on the walk defends towards the leg side
bit of extra bounce which Morkel gets from his monstrous height, and Trott edges down to third man
lovely shot, a bit fuller and Strauss drives through extra cover on the up
watches it pass the off stump
good length and tight line, defended back to the bowler
sharp delivery gets the inside edge and plops out into the leg side
starts well enough as Trott guides it down to third man
defended into off
short ball, far too easy for Strauss, and he pulls it away for four
Strauss on the walk a little and defends into the leg side
defended into leg
bit of alarm for Strauss as a leading edge loops out but falls short of mid-on
and starts with a half volley that Trott easily clips to midwicket for four
chipped into leg for a single
mistimed to short extra
attempted cut can't beat the fielder
drifts down the leg side, an extra run for England. Not that they need it
better this time as Strauss defends from the crease
bit too much width and it's neatly guided down to third man
round the wicket and finds the outside edge again, Strauss collects a single to third man
dismissive from Trott, dropped short and it's easily dispatched through midwicket with that commanding pull stroke
angled down to third man
almost finds a leading edge back to the bowler as Strauss is squared up a touch
defended with soft hands square to point
loose from Strauss, he pokes at this without any footwork or conviction and almost gets an edge
starts with a floaty full toss which is pushed to midwicket
outside off, Trott opens the face and finds the gap through square cover
round the wicket now, defended from middle stump
tossed up very full, driven firmly to short cover
five balls is all it took for Botha. He beats Strauss's attempted cut with one that kept coming in with the arm and cramped him for room. Struck the pad first and it was plumb.
comes forward on off stump and turned to midwicket
opens the face and collects another to third man

dropped Pietersen has a life as Morne Morkel puts down a comfortable chance at long leg from a top-edged hook...the bouncer was quite high and he couldn't control the shot, but Morkel made a complete hash of the chance
pushed to one of those two midwickets
guided down to third man
a calmer stroke from Pietersen this time as he leaves outside off
full on off stump, driven firmly and to the left hand of mid-off...Pietersen scampers through
worked down to long on
pushed into the off side
eased through the infield to long on
now he's gone...what a lame dismissal, chipped gently to midwicket and Botha has his second
on middle, defended to the leg side
dragged down a little but Collingwood picks out point
on off stump, defended to the bowler
ooh, that is nearly dragged back into the stumps from his pads as he attempts to turn through the leg side...Michael Vaughan had a habit of falling like that, and it's also happened to Stuart Broad
clipped firmly to midwicket
tries to collect to third man but backward point cuts it off
onto the front foot and driven square to backward point
flicked from off stump to JP Duminy stationed at the squarer of two short midwickets
goes back in the crease, turned into the gap at square leg
tucked off middle and leg down to short fine-leg
very full, dug out into his foot and rolls to the off side
comes forward on off stump and defends
good stuff from Botha, on off stump and defended to the off side
quicker ball, flicked down to short fine-leg
on off stump, defended towards mid-off
offered some width and Collingwood carves down to third man
angling into Trott who opens the face and finds third man
another goes, the in-form Collingwood departs as he advances at McLaren, plays defensively and gets a thick outside which is swallowed by Boucher
round the wicket, finds the edge again but this one flies wide of Boucher (no first slip in place) and down to third man
punched firmly to mid-off
outside off and left alone
worked out to midwicket
quicker ball outside off, opens the face and finds deep point
round the wicket, Morgan leans forward and defends on off stump
tossed up and met with a full face as he drives down to long-off
well bowled again, on off stump, defend out to cover
that's a good one, angling in from round the wicket and beats Morgan as he plays forward
defended square to AB de Villiers at backward point
not offering up any width, Morgan defends straight down the pitch
played solidly to short cover
full, wide and edged through the vacant first slip area as he drives hard...South Africa can only blame themselves for not putting a standard slip in
left outside off
a low full toss is met with a strong, flat sweep by Trott which flies through midwicket
back on a length outside off, pushed down the pitch
brings out the reverse sweep and there's a huge appeal for leg before, but it came straight off the bottom edge
defended into the off side
worked out to midwicket
pushed out behind square on the off side
good start after the break from Langeveldt, finding some extra bounce to beat Morgan's attempted cut
fuller this time and defended into the off side
just outside off, a good line to Morgan, and it's defended into off
defends from the crease
firm drive into the off side but it's incepted by Smith at short extra, good fielding
slower ball to finish and it Morgan watches it pass harmlessly
a misfield promptly allows him to get a single to long on
nicely bowled, just held back a little and defended into the off side
driven firmly back to the bowler
defended into the leg side
Morgan, urging himself on between deliveries, guides this one down to long on
nice bowling from Botha, with a big gap on the leg side he floated it outside off, inviting Trott to swipe, but instead he defends into the off side
good length ball defended back to the bowler
the pressure builds and Morgan tries to release with a pull shot to leg, but the ball wasn't short enough and he mistimes it just over the infield
defended this time, good pressure from South Africa
lovely timing. Slightly fuller slower ball, Morgan waits and drills it through short extra without a follow through and it flew to the boundary
played defensively back to the bowler
tighter line and prodded into the leg side.
it's not yet. But Trott does works it down to long on
another lovely shot from Morgan. Cleared his front leg and just threw his arms through the ball and it rocketed away through cover
defended to off
turned into the leg side
just waited on it and guided it wide of extra cover for a single
blocked solidly to the leg side
good line on off stump and defended towards point
too close to cut and Morgan is beaten as the ball flashes between inside edge and off stump
another play and miss! Morgan flashes outside off stump and is beaten
this time it's closer and worked into leg side
catches a thick outside edge and passes down to third man for a couple
slightly fuller and defended to mid-on
and there's his fifty! Knocked into the off-side, and it's 50 from 74 balls. Simple stuff for him it seems
blocked into the leg side
couple of steps, meets it on the full and pushes it to mid off
worked into the leg side and the fielder runs past it
defended watchfully
good line and pace from Morkel, certainly bowling himself into the Test team here and Morgan defends into the leg side
edged past slip for four and that's it. England win by seven wickets with 18.4 overs to spare.
